p: In our study, the fractionation of the essential oil of Niphogeton dissecta afforded a pure sequiterpene: acorenone B. Several authors reported the occurrence of acorenone B in other volatile fractions, such as the ones of Bothriochloa intermedia (47%) [ 24], Bothriochloa pertusa (9.8%) [ 28], Chaerophyllum hirsutum (9.47% to 18.49%) [ 26], Euphorbia macrorrhiza (16.72% and 25.80%) [ 29], Levisticum persicum (8.3% to 12.6%) [ 30], and as a major compound in Daucus littoralis subsp. Hyrcanicus (19.7% to 57.5% in all parts) [ 31], and Bothriochloa bladhii (18.2%) [ 32].
